title: Benedict Cumberbatch: "Becoming a father helped me become a better Hamlet" - Showbiz
text: Benedict Cumberbatch has revealed the birth of his son helped him improve his performance as Hamlet on stage.Christopher Carlton Cumberbatch was born in June to the actor and his theatre director wife Sophie Hunter. © Johan PerssonBenedict Cumberbatch (Hamlet) in Hamlet Now, speaking to Melvyn Bragg on The South Bank Show (via Radio Times), Cumberbatch revealed he "used to think you have to be childless to be a Hamlet", but that his opinions have since changed.He said: "I thought that it may be a difficult ingredient to play with but it's miraculous – as I'm sure you know being a dad – that your thinking about how you were parented shoots up as well."So that's all fed into it. It's serendipity though, that wasn't as planned as this was." © Getty Images / David M Benett He also told Bragg about the physical implications of starring in the play virtually every night, saying it makes him "tired and hungry".He said: "I drop it all very, very quickly because I have to eat and sleep. That's honestly the truth. And get home, to a newborn."The South Bank Show starts its new series on Sky Arts on Wednesday October 14 at 9pm with a profile show on Benedict Cumberbatch.
